item.title: Stock to watch: Freshworks share price to be in focus on Monday after THIS step by Girish Mathrubootham

review.headline_rewrite: Stock to watch: Freshworks share price to be in focus on Monday after THIS step by Girish Mathrubootham
bullets: Stock to watch: The share price of Freshworks, a Nasdaq-listed software firm, is likely to be the focus of attention on Monday, September 8,
His decision to step down comes just one and a half years after he quit as the chief executive officer (CEO) of the software-as-a-service
Mathrubootham, who co-founded the company with Shanmugam Krishnasamy in 2010, will step down as chairman of the board and retire on December 1, 2025.

item.title: Bull vs bear: Can GST reform bring the Indian stock market out of the league of worst performers in global markets?

review.headline_rewrite: Bull vs bear: Can GST reform bring the Indian stock market out of the league of worst performers in global markets?
bullets: However, the spike in the key benchmark indices was short-lived as profit-booking triggered in the second half, paring most of the morning gains.
The BSE Sensex has shed 0.58% in one year, and the 30-stock index has gained 2.81% YTD.
Speaking on the GST reforms' impact on the Indian stock market, Avinash Gorakshkar, a SEBI-registered fundamental analyst, said, "GST reforms are a right step
As new GST taxes are being implemented from 22 September 2025, their impact on the Q2FY26 results will be minimal.

item.title: AI in agriculture: Time to move from demos to decisions

review.headline_rewrite: AI in agriculture: Time to move from demos to decisions
bullets: From advisories like NPSS (National Pest Surveillance System) to intelligent governance dashboard, AI is perceived as the game-changer from our policymakers to farmers.
Over the past year, while companies like Farmitopia, Plantix have explored computer vision for pest and disease management, companies like Sarvam.ai have displayed potential
A multilingual chatbot that tells a farmer when to sow seeds sounds impressive — until you realise it doesn’t understand local soil moisture or
But agriculture — more than almost any sector — demands systems that are deeply local, painfully specific, and built for high-stakes variability.
